definitions.definition: Attended with peril; dangerous, risky.
definitions.example: The situation became parlous when the weather made resupply impossible.

definitions.definition: Appalling, dire, terrible.
definitions.example: Those manning the facility were in a parlous state.

definitions.definition: Dangerously clever or cunning; also, remarkably good or unusual.
Extremely, very.
(often with at) To lash out; to strike or hit at someone or something, particularly something in arm's length of the striker and at or near the level of the striker's head.
To strongly criticize or make a verbal attack, particularly as a response to previous criticism or provocation.
To draw a line through some text such as a printed or written sentence, with the purpose of deleting that text from the rest of the document.
To treat something as settled
Of a batter, to be retired after three strikes (missed swings, as opposed to any other way of becoming "out"); of a pitcher, to cause this to happen to the batter.
definitions.example: Jones struck out on a nasty slider.

definitions.definition: To fail; to be refused a request or to have a proposal not be accepted, in particular a request for a (hopefully romantic) date.
definitions.example: Dave asked the new girl to the dance but he struck out.

definitions.definition: To begin to make one's way.
definitions.example: The travellers struck out towards the line of mountains.

definitions.definition: Any regulation requiring people to be off the streets and in their homes by a certain time.
The time when such restriction begins.
A signal indicating this time.
A fireplace accessory designed to bank a fire by completely covering the embers.
A regulation in feudal Europe by which fires had to be covered up or put out at a certain fixed time in the evening, marked by the ringing of an evening bell.
The evening bell, which continued to be rung in many towns after the regulation itself became obsolete.
An act or instance of conveying.
A means of transporting, especially a vehicle.
An instrument transferring title of an object from one person or group of persons to another.
To transfer (the title) of an object from one person or group of persons to another.
A person who kidnaps someone.
A heavy snowstorm; a blizzard.
Any weather condition in which visibility and contrast are severely reduced by snow or sand causing the horizon and physical features of the terrain to disappear.
Correction fluid (from the brand name Wite-Out).
A sporting event where all in attendance are urged to wear white apparel.
The simulated erasure of a file, etc. on a read-only volume.
The suppression of a story by the media, analogously to deleting information with correction fluid.
The silencing of voices and perspectives other than those of white men.
(law enforcement) A criminal investigation that has not been solved after a considerable time but remains “on the books” and may be reopened when new evidence appears.
A refrigerated display case used for selling items that are kept cold.
A musical instrument of the brass family, slightly smaller than a trumpet, usually in the musical key of B-flat.
A piece of paper twisted to be used as a container.
A pastry shell to be filled with ice-cream, hence an ice cream cone.
A troop of cavalry; so called from its being accompanied by a cornet player.
A kind of organ stop.
The white headdress worn by the Sisters of Charity.
The standard flown by a cavalry troop.
The fifth commissioned officer in a cavalry troop, who carried the colours (equivalent to the ensign in infantry).
An item of clothing made from wool
definitions.example: Put all the woolens in this basket.

definitions.definition: Made of wool.
Of or relating to wool or woolen cloths.
definitions.example: a woolen draper

definitions.definition: An excessive and dangerous dose of a drug.
definitions.example: die of a heroin overdose.

definitions.definition: To dose excessively, to take an overdose.
definitions.example: Be careful not to overdose on those pills.

definitions.definition: To indulge in something excessively.
To dose to excess; to give an overdose, or too many doses, to.
Lacking confidence in others; distrustful.
Lacking self-confidence; timid; modest
To travel in rugged terrain instead of on a paved track.
Designed for, used for, or taking place on a driving surface that is not traditionally paved, such as a beach or rugged terrain
Not situated on a street; e.g. off-street parking, in contrast to parking on a street.
(clothing) One's dress; what one wears; one's clothes.
The single horn of a deer or stag.
To clothe or adorn.
definitions.example: He stood there, attired in his best clothes, waiting for applause.

definitions.definition: Unwilling to take risks; especially reluctant to accept a bargain with an uncertain payoff rather than another bargain with a more certain, but possibly lower, expected payoff.
Unmotivated by personal interest; unbiased, disinterested.
Not interested; indifferent, not concerned.
definitions.example: I was uninterested in the TV program, so I read a book instead.

definitions.definition: A form of entertainment popular in clubs, at parties, etc, in which individual members of the public sing along to pre-recorded instrumental versions of popular songs, the lyrics of which are displayed for the singer on a screen in time with the music.
A karaoke session.
To perform karaoke
Pursuit of an advantage by appearing to be willing to risk a dangerous policy rather than concede a point.
definitions.example: The diplomat accused the other nation's leader of brinkmanship for refusing to redeploy the troops along their nations' shared border.

definitions.definition: A person who commits multiple (more than two) murders, especially similar ones with no obvious motive over a period of time with a "cooling-off" period between each murder.
A word or phrase which has recently been coined; a new word or phrase.
The act or instance of coining, or uttering a new word.
The newly coined, meaningless words or phrases of someone with a psychosis, usually schizophrenia.
The introduction of new doctrine, for example in theology.
A valley, especially in the form of a natural hollow, small and deep.
A young woman; a wench.
A member of a congregation.
To quarantine or isolate oneself from others, especially in order to avoid spreading a communicable disease.
A patient whose treatment needs at least one night's residence in a hospital; a hospitalized patient.
Larceny of property whose value is greater than an amount set by law to distinguish it from petty larceny
(grammar) a word (such as because) that expresses a reason or a cause
Of, relating to, or being a cause of something; causing
definitions.example: There is no causal relationship between eating carrots and seeing in the dark.

definitions.definition: Somebody with whom one works; a coworker.
The act of fainting, syncope.
definitions.example: She suffered another faint.

definitions.definition: The state of one who has fainted; a swoon.
(of a being) Lacking strength; weak; languid; inclined to lose consciousness
definitions.example: I felt faint after my fifth gin and tonic.

definitions.definition: Lacking courage, spirit, or energy; cowardly; dejected
Barely perceptible; not bright, or loud, or sharp
definitions.example: There was a faint red light in the distance.

definitions.definition: Performed, done, or acted, weakly; not exhibiting vigor, strength, or energy
definitions.example: faint efforts

definitions.definition: Slight; minimal.

To lose consciousness through a lack of oxygen or nutrients to the brain, usually as a result of suddenly reduced blood flow (may be caused by emotional trauma, loss of blood or various medical conditions).
To sink into dejection; to lose courage or spirit; to become depressed or despondent.
To decay; to disappear; to vanish.
Clothing worn for leisure or as general casual wear.

The highest form of bishop, in the ancient world having authority over other bishops in the province but now generally as an honorary title; in Roman Catholicism, considered a bishop second only to the Pope in rank.

In Biblical contexts, a male leader of a family, tribe or ethnic group, especially one of the twelve sons of Jacob (considered to have created the twelve tribes of Israel) or (in plural) Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
A founder of a political or religious movement, an organization or an enterprise.
An old leader of a village or community.
The male progenitor of a genetic or tribal line, or of a clan or extended family.
The male head of a household or nuclear family.
A small shallow dish to hold a cup and catch drips.
An object round and gently curved (shaped like a saucer).
definitions.example: The saucer-shaped object could have been a UFO.

definitions.definition: A small pan or vessel in which sauce was set on a table.
A flat, shallow caisson for raising sunken ships.
A shallow socket for the pivot of a capstan.
To pour (tea, etc.) from the cup into the saucer in order to cool it before drinking.
Any of several Old World nocturnal, carnivorous mammals, of the genus Genetta in the family Viverridae, most of which have a spotted coat and a long, ringed tail.
The fur of this mammal, or any skin dressed in imitation of it.
A group of genetically identical individuals (plants, fungi, bacteria etc.) that have grown in a given location, all originating from asexual reproduction of a single ancestor; a group of ramets.
A small-sized, well-proportioned, Spanish horse; a jennet.
A weak or sentimental person.
Somebody who finds it difficult to scold or punish.
A software expert who is ignorant of the workings of hardware.
A soft drink containing no alcohol.
The act of mowing (a garden, grass etc.)
definitions.example: The lawn hasn't had a mow for a couple of months, so it's like a jungle out there!

definitions.definition: A shot played with a sweeping or scythe-like motion.
To cut down grass or crops.
definitions.example: He mowed the lawn every few weeks in the summer.

definitions.definition: To cut down or slaughter in great numbers.
A scornful grimace; a wry face.
To make grimaces, mock.
A stack of hay, corn, beans or a barn for the storage of hay, corn, beans.
The place in a barn where hay or grain in the sheaf is stowed.
To put into mows.
A gull, seagull.
A prison, or other place of confinement.
A hiding place; a secret store or den.
A breeding-cage for birds.
A cage for hawks, especially while moulting.
(in the plural) A building or set of buildings where moulting birds are kept.
The crying sound of a cat; a meow, especially of a kitten.
The crying sound of a gull.
An exclamation of disapproval; a boo.
A musical range or section higher than bass and lower than alto.
A person, instrument or group that performs in the tenor (higher than bass and lower than alto) range.
A musical part or section that holds or performs the main melody, as opposed to the contratenor bassus and contratenor altus, who perform countermelodies.
The lowest tuned in a ring of bells.
Tone, as of a conversation.
Duration; continuance; a state of holding on in a continuous course; general tendency; career.
The subject in a metaphor to which attributes are ascribed.
Time to maturity of a bond.
Stamp; character; nature.
An exact copy of a writing, set forth in the words and figures of it. It differs from purport, which is only the substance or general import of the instrument.
That course of thought which holds on through a discourse; the general drift or course of thought; purport; intent; meaning; understanding.
A tenor saxophone.
Of or pertaining to the tenor part or range.
definitions.example: He has a tenor voice.

definitions.definition: A condition of total, interlocking traffic congestion on the streets or highways of a crowded city, in which no one can move because everyone is in someone else's way.

On a smaller scale: the situation in which cars enter a signal-controlled intersection too late during the green light cycle, and are unable to clear the intersection (due to congestion in the next block) when the light turns red, thus blocking the cross traffic when it's their turn to go. Repeated at enough intersections, this phenomenon can lead to citywide gridlock.
(by extension) any paralysis of a complex system due to severe congestion, conflict, or deadlock.
To cause traffic congestion
Composed of large parts or particles; of inferior quality or appearance; not fine in material or close in texture.
Lacking refinement, taste or delicacy.
definitions.example: coarse language

definitions.definition: An uneven patch of color or discoloration.
An irregularly shaped area.
Imperfection; blemish on one’s reputation, stain.
Any of various crop diseases that cause the plant to form spots.
A bright or dark spot on old film caused by dirt and loss of the gelatin covering the film, due to age and poor film quality.
A dark spot on the skin; a pustule.
To mark with blotches.
To develop blotches, to become blotchy.
To overflow, as by water from excessive rainfall.
To cover or partly fill as if by a flood.
definitions.example: The floor was flooded with beer.

definitions.definition: To provide (someone or something) with a larger number or quantity of something than can easily be dealt with.
definitions.example: The station's switchboard was flooded with listeners making complaints.

definitions.definition: To paste numerous lines of text to (a chat system) in order to disrupt the conversation.
To bleed profusely, as after childbirth.
An act of flooding; a flood or gush.
Emotional overwhelm sometimes leading to a primal state of rage or panic.
A duty-free article, especially part of the allowance of such goods allowed to be imported.
definitions.example: We brought back so much duty-free we could hardly walk.

definitions.definition: A shop where duty-free goods can be bought.
definitions.example: Have you been to Melbourne airport's duty-free?

definitions.definition: Exempt from duty, especially from customs duty.
An athletics field event where one has to travel as far as possible after taking one hop, a step, then a jump
The mother of one's spouse.
A mother-in-law apartment.
A mother-in-law sandwich.
A stepmother.
A branch of applied science concerned with food and its production.
A very small passerine bird, Regulus regulus, that breeds in Eurasia.
As an initial point; before any other considerations.
A device measuring the time of day by the position of a shadow cast by a pole or plate (gnomon) upon an engraved series of marks.
Able to conduct electrical current or heat.
definitions.example: Distilled water is very slightly electrically conductive.

definitions.definition: Of, or relating to conductivity of a material.
The amount by which something goes too far.
definitions.example: Let's see if we can predict and correct for the overshoot.

definitions.definition: When the population of a species exceeds its environment's carrying capacity.
To go past something; to go too far.
definitions.example: When you drive, you must remember to not overshoot the parking space and end up with two wheels over the line.

definitions.definition: To shoot beyond; to shoot too far to hit something.
To pass swiftly over; to fly beyond.
To exceed.
definitions.example: to overshoot the truth

definitions.definition: To venture too far; to overreach (oneself).

An argument whose conclusion is supported by two premises, of which one contains the term that is the predicate of the conclusion, and the other contains the term that is the subject of the conclusion; common to both premises is a term that is excluded from the conclusion.
A trick, artifice; an extremely subtle, sophisticated, or deceptive argument; a sophism.
Any species of Cottus; a sculpin.
Dirty, unwashed, unclean.
definitions.example: He's a grubby little boy, always playing around by the stream.

definitions.definition: Having grubs in it.
Relating to tides
Stationary with respect to the current, having no momentum propulsion.
Doomed; unable to succeed.
Of or pertaining to piety, exhibiting piety, devout, godfearing.
Admired, distinguished, respected, or well-known, especially due to past achievements or noble qualities.
The distance between different social groups, e.g. in terms of class, ethnicity, gender-identity, sexual-identity, etc.
(proxemics) An appropriate distance for interactions among acquaintances during epidemics.
(proxemics) To maintain a certain distance between at least two people to contain the spread of an infectious disease.
To (cause to) be or become an adult.
To behave like an adult.
Engaging in activities typically associated with adulthood.
definitions.example: 2013, Kelly Williams Brown, Adulting: How to Become a Grown-up in 468 Easy(ish) Steps

definitions.definition: Adultery.
A group of civilians trained and organized in a military fashion, but which do not represent the formal forces of a sovereign power.
A member of a paramilitary group.
Relating to a paramilitary
An organized search for a criminal or enemy.
definitions.example: After the murderer escaped, there was a full-scale manhunt to catch him.

definitions.definition: A sweetened drink, made with oranges but often containing additional flavourings, that is served diluted with water.
The doctrine that all actions are determined by the current state and immutable laws of the universe, with no possibility of choice.
The property of having behavior determined only by initial state and input.
To lift, move, or collect with a scoop or as though with a scoop.
definitions.example: He used both hands to scoop water and splash it on his face.

definitions.definition: To make hollow; to dig out.
definitions.example: I tried scooping a hole in the sand with my fingers.

definitions.definition: To report on something, especially something worthy of a news article, before (someone else).
definitions.example: The paper across town scooped them on the City Hall scandal.

definitions.definition: (often with "up") To begin a vocal note slightly below the target pitch and then to slide up to the target pitch, especially in country music.
To pick (someone) up
definitions.example: You have a car. Can you come and scoop me?

definitions.definition: To uncover; to show and display that which was hidden.
To communicate that which could not be known or discovered without divine or supernatural instruction.
Something revealed; a revelation.
Informative.
definitions.example: a revealing analysis

definitions.definition: Of clothing: allowing more than is usual to be seen.
definitions.example: Her shirt is rather revealing.

definitions.definition: A type of game existing as and controlled by software, usually run by a video game console or a computer, played on a video terminal or television screen, and controlled by a paddle, joystick, joypad, mouse, or keyboard.
Any polymer whose monomers are linked together by ester bonds
A material or fabric made from polyester polymer
Of, or consisting of polyesters
Bold and spirited, cheeky, impudent, saucy.
Somewhat sexy and provocative.
Lively, vigorous.
An SI unit of length equal to 10-2 metres. Symbol: cm
Active strength or force of body or mind; capacity for exertion, physically, intellectually, or morally; energy.
Strength or force in animal or vegetable nature or action.
Strength; efficacy; potency.
To contradict, to provide proof that something is not.
definitions.example: The thought is that you see an episode of observation, experiment, or reasoning as confirming or infirming a hypothesis depending on whether your probability for it increases or decreases during the episode.

definitions.definition: Weak or ill, not in good health.
definitions.example: He was infirm of body but still keen of mind, and though it looked like he couldn't walk across the room, he crushed me in debate.

definitions.definition: Irresolute; weak of mind or will.
Frail; unstable; insecure.
A table on which a patient lies during a surgical operation.
A financial transaction for a very small amount of money
Black bile, formerly thought to be one of the four "cardinal humours" of animal bodies.
Great sadness or depression, especially of a thoughtful or introspective nature.
Affected with great sadness or depression.
definitions.example: Melancholy people don't talk much.

definitions.definition: Running shoe, trainer
A soldier trained to use a rifle as their primary weapon.
definitions.example: The riflemen had not been issued their weapons yet, and hence they trained with wooden mock-up rifles.

definitions.definition: A person especially skilled in the use of a rifle.
definitions.example: She was quite the rifleman and could pick off a squirrels with a .22 from across the field with amazing accuracy.

definitions.definition: A small wrenlike insectivorous passerine bird endemic to New Zealand, Acanthisitta chloris, the titipounamu.

In the Anglican and Eastern Orthodox systems, a senior administrative official in a diocese, just under the bishop, often in charge of an archdeaconry. As a title, it can be filled by either a deacon or priest.
A person with hypertension
A drug that increases blood pressure
Of, pertaining to, or causing hypertension.
A part of any device that functions in or near the mouth, especially:
A spokesman; one who speaks on behalf of someone else.
definitions.example: The novel's protagonist serves as a mouthpiece for the author's political views.

definitions.definition: A lawyer for the defense.
A severe mental disorder, sometimes with physical damage to the brain, marked by a deranged personality and a distorted view of reality.
The skills of the theater.
definitions.example: To be a professional actor you need to learn stagecraft.

definitions.definition: A specific skill of the theater.
definitions.example: Lighting is a very technical stagecraft.
